div.head: ¶ T. A. in praise of the Authour.

lg.l: FOr him, whome Pallas with hir milke did nurse
And lullabide vpon the Muses lappes,
Tis not so rare to write a braue discourse
Of strange aduentures past, and vncouth happes.
Ne is it harde, a greater taske to welde,
VVhereas the Theame sufficiet scope doth yeeld▪
But hee that neuer tasted Learnings lore,
Nor many a Region nie Pernassus came,
To write in things but seldome seene before,
In that respect demerites double fame:
But specially vpon such toies to write,
As yeelde so little matter to endite.
Then Tarleton thou deseruest double praise,
Sith that with arte so slenderly possest,
Thy Muse hir nature in these toies displaies
More learnedly than any of the rest:
VVhose gifts of Arte so farre inferior be
To those which Nature planted hath in thee.
